summary_points.title: Muted Market Open Expected
summary_points.summary: Indian benchmarks Sensex and Nifty are poised for a subdued opening amid mixed global cues and Gift Nifty trends, with Gift Nifty trading around 24,761.50 – a premium of nearly 14 points from Nifty futures’ previous close – signaling limited initial volatility.

summary_points.title: Rebound Snaps Losing Streak
summary_points.summary: After three straight sessions of losses, the Sensex rallied 554.84 points (0.70%) to close at 80,364.49, and the Nifty gained 198.20 points (0.81%) to finish at 24,625.05, driven by broad-based sectoral buying that reflected renewed investor confidence.

summary_points.title: Positive Global Sentiment Post SCO Summit
summary_points.summary: Asian markets traded mostly higher following the SCO Summit in Tianjin, while US markets were closed for Labour Day, providing a supportive backdrop for Indian equities to open in green, even as tariff uncertainty continues to loom large.

summary_points.title: Domestic GDP Growth Bolsters Stocks
summary_points.summary: Stronger-than-expected Q1 GDP growth of 7.8% lifted domestic sentiment, helping the Sensex open at 80,143.59 (up 333.94 points or 0.42%) and the Nifty at 24,511.30 (up 84.45 points or 0.35%), as investors cheered the robust economic expansion.

summary_points.title: US Tariff Developments Create Uncertainty
summary_points.summary: A US appeals court ruled most of President Trump’s tariffs unlawful but allowed them to remain effective until mid-October, adding complexity to trade relations and raising concerns over potential 50% duties on Indian exports that could dampen corporate earnings.

summary_points.title: Geopolitical Tensions and FII Outflows May Cap Gains
summary_points.summary: Analysts warn that deteriorating India-US relations, the threat of steep US tariffs and ongoing foreign institutional investor outflows may keep market moves range-bound, tempering the upside despite favourable domestic data.

articles.title: Sensex, Nifty open higher ahead of GST Council meet as investors eye major tax cuts - India Today
articles.snippet: The S&P BSE Sensex gained around 200 points in early trade, while the NSE Nifty50 hovered above 24,600. Broader markets mirrored the upbeat sentiment, extending gains from the previous session.

top_performing_sectors.summary: Nifty Auto led the rally with a 2.54% gain, powered by strong contributions from Mahindra & Mahindra and Tata Motors.
Consumer Durables climbed 1.91% on robust buying in names like Trent, reflecting strength in discretionary spending.
The IT sector advanced 1.52%, led by a rally in Infosys, amid renewed investor interest in technology stocks.

underperforming_sectors.summary: Nifty Media was the only sector in the red, sliding 0.07% as investors booked profits in advertising and broadcasting names.
FMCG eked out just a 0.07% gain, reflecting muted sentiment in consumer staples despite overall market strength.
Healthcare saw modest gains of 0.19%, underperforming broader indices as investor focus remained on cyclical and tech names.

gainers.reason: Led the rally with a 2.98% jump, benefiting from strength in the auto sector.
Rose 2.86% on continued auto sector outperformance.
Climbed 2.65% as part of broad-based buying across sectors.

losers.reason: Dropped 2.05%, marking the biggest decline of the day.
Fell 0.92%, with no specific catalyst mentioned in the report.
Declined 0.34%, with no clear reason cited in the text.

market_drivers.summary: Indian equities opened higher as investors grew optimistic ahead of the two-day GST Council meeting, where a significant tax rate overhaul is expected to spur consumption demand; at the same time, relief rallies in major auto and IT counters and a 1% uptick in Reliance Industries drove sectoral breadth. However, lingering concerns over escalating U.S. tariffs and trade tensions kept foreign institutional outflows in check, with currency fluctuations under the microscope. Healthy domestic institutional flows helped offset some FII selling, enabling the Sensex to climb roughly 200 points and the Nifty to hold above 24,600.
